info.title: KMS Connect API
info.description:
This section outlines the resources used by KMS Connect to implement and comply with the Interoperability.

AllergyIntolerance

The AllergyIntolerance resource provides the clinical assessment of a patient’s allergy or intolerance when exposed to a specific substance or class of substance including information about the adverse reaction

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/allergyintolerance.html


Appointment

The Appointment resources are used to provide information about a planned meeting that may be in the future or past. The visit scheduled by an appointment may be in person or remote (by phone, video conference, etc.)

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/appointment.html


Binary

The Binary resource that represents the data of a single raw artifact as digital content accessible in its native format. The resource can contain any clinical content such as text, images, and PDFs, and is currently limited to Continuity of Care Documents (CCD), clinical documents, diagnostic reports (Anatomic Pathology, Cardiology, Microbiology, and Radiology, etc.), and communication message content.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/binary.html


Communication

The Communication resource is a record of a request for a communication to be performed. This resource is a conveyance of information from one entity, a sender, to another entity, a receiver. The sender and receivers may be patients, practitioners, related persons, organizations, and devices.

References: https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/communicationrequest.html


Condition

The Condition resource is used to record detailed information about a condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept of a particular aspect of a patient's state of health.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/condition.html


DiagnosticReport

The DiagnosticReport typically provides findings and interpretation of diagnostic tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/diagnosticreport.html


DocumentReference

A DocumentReference resource is used to index documents such as read Continuity of Care Documents (CCD), get a list of clinical documents, clinical notes of a patient, non-patient specific documents, also other binary objects.

References: http://hl7.org/fhir/r4/documentreference.html


FamilyMemberHistory

This resource records significant health conditions for a particular individual related to the subject.
This resource represents a simple structure used to capture an 'elementary' family history for a particular family member.

References: http://www.hl7.org/Fhir/familymemberhistory.html


Immunization

The Immunization resource includes the recording of the current and historical administration of vaccinations to a patient across all healthcare disciplines in all healthcare settings. This resource covers the key concept of querying of a patient's immunization history.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/immunization.html


Location

The Location resource is intended to describe the more physical structures managed/operated by an organization, includes both incidental locations (a place which is used for healthcare without prior designation or authorization) and dedicated, formally appointed locations. The top level of the patient location hierarchy is facilities, which are also an Organization resource that is linked to patient locations. All organizations are facilities, but not all facilities are organizations. An ambulatory patient care area, such as a clinic or an emergency room, can also be a location, while a facility, building, nursing unit, room, and bed are the highest to lowest levels of the location hierarchy.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/location.html


MedicationAdministration

The MedicationAdministration resource describes the event of a patient consuming or otherwise being administered a medication. This may be as simple as swallowing a tablet or it may be a long running infusion. Related resources tie this event to the authorizing prescription, and the specific encounter between patient and health care practitioner.

References: https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/medicationadministration.html


MedicationRequest

The MedicationRequest resource provides orders for all medications along with administration instructions for a patient in both the inpatient and outpatient setting (orders/prescriptions filled by a pharmacy and discharge medication orders). This resource also includes a patient’s historical or documented home medications reported by the patient, significant other or another provider.

References: http://www.hl7.org/fhir/medicationrequest.html


MedicationStatement

MedicationStatement is a set of records of medications that are consumed by a patient now or in the past, future orders are not returned. This resource is reported by either the patient, significant other or a provider.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/medicationstatement.html


NutritionOrder

The NutritionOrder resource describes a request for oral diets (including general diets such as General Healthy diet, or therapeutic diets such as Consistent Carbohydrate, 2-gram Sodium, or Fluid Restricted), oral nutrition supplements (such as nutritionally complete pre-packed drinks), enteral nutrition (tube feedings) and infant formula which govern the distribution of food and nutritional products used to feed patients within an in-patient setting. This resource is intended to be used by providers from various specialties such as physicians, dietitians/nutritionists, or speech therapists.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/nutritionorder.html


Observation

The Observation resource provides measurements or simple assertions about a patient that are useful for establishing baselines or trends, monitoring a patient’s progress, and establishing diagnoses

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/observation.html


Organization

The Organization resource describes a grouping of people or business entities relevant to the healthcare process. Hospitals, employers, insurance companies, physicians' offices, rehabilitation facilities, laboratories, and other businesses are examples of organizations.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/organization.html


Patient

The Patient resource provides a person's overall demographic information, who is receiving healthcare services from a particular organization. Patient id, patient name, gender, date of birth, address, phone, primary language, and marital status are all common demographic fields. Time of birth, race, ethnicity, and birth sex are examples of additional concepts returned as extensions and not included in the base resource.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/patient.html


Practitioner

The Practitioner resource contains information about a person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of healthcare. Physicians, nurses, pharmacists, therapists, technologists, and social workers are just a few examples of practitioners. Although not all practitioners have access to the EHR, it can be used by other resources to show that they are involved in a patient's care in some way.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/practitioner.html


Procedure

The Procecdure resource is used to record the details of the current and historical of medical and surgical procedures performed on or for a patient as part of the provision of care.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/procedure.html


ServiceRequest

The ServiceRequest resource returns the requests or orders for procedures, diagnostic tests or other services to be performed on a patient.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/servicerequest.html

Slot

The Slot resource returns time slots that are available for booking an appointment from a schedule. There is no actual information about appointments in slots; only its availability and type are listed. In integrating an application with a client's production environment, enterprises will need to collaborate with the client to determine which Practitioner and Location ids they want to make available to the third-party scheduling applications.

References: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/slot.html
